plan-back-refactor.description: Create a Linear plan for backend refactoring/tech-debt (FastAPI + async SQLAlchemy + Postgres) without changing code
plan-back-refactor.template:
Scan the backend codebase (Python, FastAPI, async SQLAlchemy, Postgres) and produce a refactoring plan to improve correctness, maintainability, and performance.

Requirements:
- Create a Linear parent issue in team "StatsboardBack" titled "Backend refactor + hardening plan".
- Create child issues (or a checklist) grouped by theme:
  1) Type safety and linting (typing gaps, pyright/mypy findings, ruff issues)
  2) FastAPI architecture (dependency injection, routing structure, response models, validation)
  3) Async SQLAlchemy correctness (session lifecycle, transactions, N+1 prevention, await discipline)
  4) Postgres and migrations (alembic hygiene, data-loss risks, indexes/query hotspots, EXPLAIN targets)
  5) Testing and reliability (pytest coverage gaps, async tests, fixtures, flaky tests)
  6) Security and error handling (authz boundaries, input validation, exception handlers, logging)
- For each child issue include:
  - Scope and goal
  - Affected modules/files (top offenders first)
  - Proposed approach + safety notes (incl. migration/data-risk if any)
  - Suggested verification (tests, checks, queries)
  - Estimated effort (S/M/L)
- Do NOT change code yet; just produce the plan + tickets.

Then, after tickets are created, propose an execution order that minimizes risk (quick wins first, migrations last unless urgent).

work.description: Work on a Linear issue (e.g. /work STAB-8)
work.template:
Start working on Linear issue $ARGUMENTS.

Rules:
- Linear team: StatsboardBack
- Only change files related to the issue
- Follow FastAPI and async SQLAlchemy best practices
- Prefer typed code (Pyright-friendly)
- Run backend checks after changes (tests/lint/typecheck if available)
- Update the Linear issue with progress
- Move the issue to Done only when tests pass and checks are green for the scope

review.description: Review work for a Linear issue (e.g. /review STAB-8)
review.template:
Review work done for Linear issue $ARGUMENTS.

Check:
- FastAPI correctness (dependencies, routing, response models, validation)
- Async SQLAlchemy correctness (no blocking calls, proper session lifecycle, transactions)
- Postgres safety (migration/data-loss risk, index/query considerations if relevant)
- Error handling and status codes
- Security basics (authz/authn boundaries, input validation)
- Tests added/updated and passing
- Scope discipline (no unrelated refactors)

Post findings to Linear.
